General.Description: Golem is a global open source, open source supercomputer that people can access. It includes the combined power of the user's machine, from the personal computer to the entire data center. Golem has the ability to compute a variety of tasks, from CGI rendering, through computer learning to scientific computing. The limitations of Golem are only determined by the creativity of the software developers. Golem provides an economically viable platform for computing and provides software developers with a flexible, reliable and inexpensive computer resource.
General.Features: As a supercomputer accessible and distributed worldwide, Golem aims to reduce costs of scientific research, large data analysis, graphing, machine learning, AI (and more) up to 10x.
General.Technology: Golem uses Ethereum-based transactional systems to settle payments between vendors, requisitioners, and software developers. All calculations take place in a sandbox environment and are completely isolated from the server system. Software developers are at the heart of Golem's ecosystem: Application Registry and Transaction Framework allow anyone to deploy, distribute, and monetize applications in the Golem network.
